intro: Brassica rapa convar. rapifera, commonly known as Chinese cabbage, is a leafy vegetable with a short, stout stem and thick, fleshy leaves. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is native to East Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a rosette-like growth habit. Its leaves are usually dark green and can be either curly or flat, depending on the variety. It is cultivated for its edible leaves, stems, and sometimes the flowering heads.
